rminion
  • Reference

    Solving Constraint Problems with rminion

    Matthew Henderson

    2017-02-10

    Latin Squares

    library(minionator)

a <- Latin$new(3)
print(a)
    ## MINION 3
## 
## **VARIABLES**
## 
## DISCRETE l[3,3] {1..3}
## **SEARCH**
## PRINT ALL
## 
## **CONSTRAINTS**
## 
## # Latin constraints
## 
## ## Rows
## 
## alldiff([l[0, 0], l[0, 1], l[0, 2]])
## alldiff([l[1, 0], l[1, 1], l[1, 2]])
## alldiff([l[2, 0], l[2, 1], l[2, 2]])
## 
## ## Columns
## 
## alldiff([l[0, 0], l[1, 0], l[2, 0]])
## alldiff([l[0, 1], l[1, 1], l[2, 1]])
## alldiff([l[0, 2], l[1, 2], l[2, 2]])
## 
## **EOF**
    library(rminion)

minion(a)
    ##   Parsing Time Setup Time First Node Time Initial Propagate
## 1            0          0               0                 0
##   First node time Solve Time Total Time Total System Time Total Wall Time
## 1               0          0          0          0.000625        0.005663
##   Maximum RSS (kB) Total Nodes Problem solvable? Solutions Found
## 1              972          23               yes              12

    Enumerate Latin squares of size at most 5

    c.f. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Latin_square

    latin_count <- function(n) minion(Latin$new(n))
counts <- do.call("rbind", lapply(1:5, latin_count))
knitr::kable(counts)
    Parsing Time Setup Time First Node Time Initial Propagate First node time Solve Time Total Time Total System Time Total Wall Time Maximum RSS (kB) Total Nodes Problem solvable? Solutions Found
    0 0 0 0 0 0.000000 0.000000 0.000415 0.000493 968 1 yes 1
    0 0 0 0 0 0.000000 0.000000 0.000469 0.000544 968 3 yes 2
    0 0 0 0 0 0.000000 0.000000 0.000556 0.000635 968 23 yes 12
    0 0 0 0 0 0.000000 0.000000 0.001454 0.002354 968 1151 yes 576
    0 0 0 0 0 0.324383 0.324383 0.000750 0.658402 968 326159 yes 161280
